results.title: Metformin attenuates white matter injury and cognitive impairment induced by chronic cerebral hypoperfusion.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ attenuates @<m>DISEASE_Leukoencephalopathies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D056784 @@@white matter injury@@@ and @DISEASE_Cognition_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D003072 @@@cognitive impairment@@@ induced by chronic @DISEASE_Cerebral_Palsy @DISEASE_MESH:D002547 @@@cerebral hypoperfusion@@@.

citations.NLM: He Y, Li Z, Shi X, Ding J, Wang X. Metformin attenuates white matter injury and cognitive impairment induced by chronic cerebral hypoperfusion. J Cereb Blood Flow Metab. 2023 May 12;():271678X231175189. PMID: 37177813

results.title: Metformin Reduces Repeat Mild Concussive Injury Pathophysiology
results.text_hl: We found that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, administered acutely after each head impact, resulted in markedly reduced @<m>DISEASE_Leukoencephalopathies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D056784 @@@white matter damage@@@, @DISEASE_Gliosis @DISEASE_MESH:D005911 @@@astrogliosis@@@, loss of hippocampal @GENE_PVALB @GENE_19293 @@@parvalbumin@@@ neurons, and improved mitochondrial function.

citations.NLM: Underwood EL, Redell JB, Maynard ME, Kobori N, Hylin MJ, Hood KN, West RK, Zhao J, Moore AN, Dash PK. Metformin Reduces Repeat Mild Concussive Injury Pathophysiology eNeuro. 2022 Jan-Feb;9(1):. PMID: 34903525

results.title: Metformin, Rapamycin, or Nicotinamide Mononucleotide Pretreatment Attenuate Cognitive Impairment After Cerebral Hypoperfusion by Inhibiting Microglial Phagocytosis

results.title: PGC-1alpha activity and mitochondrial dysfunction in preterm infants
results.text_hl: Thus, additional studies are necessary to determine whether @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ is a safe therapeutic to increase @GENE_PPARGC1A @GENE_10891 @@@PGC-1alpha@@@ activity and target the pathological processes contributing to @<m>DISEASE_Leukoencephalopathies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D056784 @@@WMI@@@ and @DISEASE_Bronchopulmonary_Dysplasia @DISEASE_MESH:D001997 @@@BPD@@@ in neonates.

citations.NLM: Mohammadi A, Higazy R, Gauda EB. PGC-1alpha activity and mitochondrial dysfunction in preterm infants Front Physiol. 2022;13():997619. PMID: 36225305
citations.BibTeX: @article{36225305, title={PGC-1alpha activity and mitochondrial dysfunction in preterm infants}, author={Mohammadi A and Higazy R and Gauda EB}, journal={Front Physiol}, volume={13}, pages={997619}}

results.title: Metformin promotes Schwann cell remyelination, preserves neural tissue and improves functional recovery after spinal cord injury.
results.text_hl: Our results showed that treating with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ after @DISEASE_Spinal_Cord_Injuries @DISEASE_MESH:D013119 @@@SCI@@@ improved functional recovery by reducing the @<m>DISEASE_Leukoencephalopathies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D056784 @@@white matter loss@@@ and promoting Schwann cell remyelination, and the @GENE_NRG1 @GENE_3084 @@@Nrg1@@@/@GENE_EGFR @GENE_1956 @@@ErbB@@@ signaling pathway may be involved in promoting remyelination mediated by oligodendrocytes and Schwann cells.

citations.NLM: Huang Z, Lin J, Jiang H, Lin W, Huang Z, Chen J, Xiao W, Lin Q, Wang J, Wen S, Zhu Q, Liu J. Metformin promotes Schwann cell remyelination, preserves neural tissue and improves functional recovery after spinal cord injury. Neuropeptides. 2023 May 19;100():102348. PMID: 37236132
citations.BibTeX: @article{37236132, title={Metformin promotes Schwann cell remyelination, preserves neural tissue and improves functional recovery after spinal cord injury.}, author={Huang Z and Lin J and Jiang H and Lin W and Huang Z and Chen J and Xiao W and Lin Q and Wang J and Wen S and Zhu Q and Liu J}, journal={Neuropeptides}, volume={100}, pages={102348}}

results.title: Particulate matter air pollutants and cardiovascular disease: Strategies for intervention.
results.text_hl: Despite the public health data, definitive mechanisms underlying @<m>DISEASE_Leukoencephalopathies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D056784 @@@PM@@@-associated @DISEASE_Cardiovascular_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D002318 @@@CVD@@@ are elusive.

citations.NLM: Aryal A, Harmon AC, Dugas TR. Particulate matter air pollutants and cardiovascular disease: Strategies for intervention. Pharmacol Ther. 2021 Jul;223():107890. PMID: 33992684
